---
title: "Unlock Labs Feature Announcement: Referral Fees for Events"
subtitle: ""
authorName: "Unlock Labs team"
publishDate: "Thu Mar 28 2024 00:00:00 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time)"
description: "Event organizers can reward their networks with referral fees using Unlock Protocol."
image: "/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/cf6078475e38ac1ea1e71996a07cc61d.jpg"
---

![Unlock Labs Feature Announcement: Referral Fees for Events](https://storage.googleapis.com/papyrus_images/cf6078475e38ac1ea1e71996a07cc61d.jpg)

<p>Cryptocurrencies are often called <em>programmable money</em>. This refers to the fact that it is possible, for example, to create smart contracts that encode and enforce rules around payments.</p><p>The Unlock Protocol includes a <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="dont-break-out notion-link-token notion-focusable-token notion-enable-hover" href="https://unlock-protocol.com/blog/referral-fees">referral mechanism at its core</a> and membership contracts can be customized to automatically pay referral fees when new memberships or tickets are purchased and minting.</p><p>Here’s a visualization of how referrals work across the Unlock network in the general case.</p><div data-type="youtube" videoid="aSjSEy8mdxI">
      <div class="youtube-player" data-id="aSjSEy8mdxI" style="background-image: url('https://i.ytimg.com/vi/aSjSEy8mdxI/hqdefault.jpg'); background-size: cover; background-position: center">
        <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aSjSEy8mdxI">
          <img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/play.png" class="play">
        </a>
      </div></div><p>This same flow illustrated in the video above is now available for event organizers and their networks as well.</p><div class="relative header-and-anchor"><h2 id="h-referral-rewards-are-an-important-tool-for-event-organizers">Referral rewards are an important tool for event organizers</h2></div><p>To date, referrals have been an underused tool in the event organizer’s toolkit.</p><p>For event organizers, the main job is to sell tickets and referrals can be incredibly useful to achieve that goal.</p><p>Often, a conference will have partners who can promote the conference in their own community. Using referrals, these partners can receive a share of the ticket sales, creating an even bigger incentive for them to promote and sell tickets.</p><div class="relative header-and-anchor"><h2 id="h-event-referral-fees-in-action">Event referral fees in action</h2></div><p>Here is an example. In the Event’s settings, a referral for <code>ccarfi.eth</code> has been set up where this address would receive 20% of any ticket sold <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="dont-break-out notion-link-token notion-focusable-token notion-enable-hover" href="https://app.unlock-protocol.com/event/my-party?referrer=0x9d3ea9e9adde71141f4534db3b9b80df3d03ee5f">thru this specific link</a>.</p><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/9d707bb4e4444ed533b570acfb4fdb04.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="1680" nextwidth="3198" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/4255408b5dbd4af94d95ca800db971ba.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="1057" nextwidth="3175" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/01bc951c1489a6454683338df6cee762.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="1470" nextwidth="3138" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><p>You can create multiple referral codes for a single event. Different partners / promoters can receive differing percentages of sales.</p><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/5a9765dbe295b215bb9018ed4b04c506.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="1290" nextwidth="2124" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><p>As an event organizer, once you have set up the referral code(s), you can share the custom referral share links with your various partners. Any ticket sales that are made from those links will reward that partner with the appropriate percentage of the ticket sale.</p><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/39f70951422af8291dadeb3761bd0707.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="1290" nextwidth="2124" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><p>If you want to inspect this on an actual transaction, <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="dont-break-out notion-link-token notion-focusable-token notion-enable-hover" href="https://sepolia.etherscan.io/tx/0xb106b90e54a4fd4323c493f8b0a4c7135a411c89dced4af1bbb2456163f7d2fd">here is an example</a>.</p><figure float="none" data-type="figure" class="img-center" style="max-width: null;"><img src="/images/blog/unlock-labs-feature-announcement--referral-fees-for-events/e7f5dce0a363813f71381001658e94c3.png" blurdataurl="data:image/png;base64," nextheight="326" nextwidth="1782" class="image-node embed"><figcaption htmlattributes="[object Object]" class="hide-figcaption"></figcaption></figure><p>Referral links can be a powerful tool for boosting event attendance and engaging communities. By providing a financial incentive, they encourage partners to promote your event within their networks.</p><p></p>
